intro: Saccocalyx lupulinus, commonly known as the golden cup fern, is a rare and delicate fern species characterized by its unique, cup-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features intricate, lace-like leaves with a yellowish hue, which contribute to its striking appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires high humidity to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
